name: I May Find Me [UE5]
description:
What is that?!!

While migrating the "I Can't Find Me" game to Unreal Engine's latest installment (UE5) I decided to test the "Hand" in the The Matrix Awaken's Demo that was released by Epic. And while it felt quite fun, and my friends loved it, I decided to put the test online for free (Perhaps a good way to test the controls for the upcoming game "I Can't Find Me").

No big effort been made in building this massive city, I did only Migrate my "Hand" player character from "I Can't Find Me" project, and set it as the default player in the Matrix's city, and did very very minor tweaks here and there on the Sample City free demo.

 Warning, this project is a very demanding one in terms of GPU effort, so be ready to hear a lot of fan kicking in your case. I did test on RTX 3070 as well as RTX3080 and it was alright (still had fans to kick in).

Mouse & Keyboard:

Move: WASD + Mouse
Jump: Space
Walk on walls: RMB (Hold)

Gamepad (tested with Xbox + PS4 on PC)

Move: Left thumbstick
Jump: A (X)
Walk on walls: LT (L2)

More about "I Can't Find Me"

Have Fun!

Disclaimer
The big city made by Epic for showcasing UE5 and it was not intended to reach the top of those high buildings during gameplay. But surprisingly there are a lot of details on top of those skyscraper, and finding some collision issues here & there should be totally understandable and tolerate-able by you.
